intro: Psychotria macrobotrys, commonly known as the sacred lotus of the Amazon, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep red. The plant produces small, dark blue to black berries that contain seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and traditional contexts.
